plants.name: Amla
plants.description: Amla, or Indian Gooseberry, is rich in vitamin C and antioxidants, beneficial for immunity, digestion, and skin health.
plants.habitat: Grows in tropical and subtropical regions, commonly found in dry, deciduous forests and fertile plains.

plants.name: Tulsi
plants.description: Tulsi, also known as Holy Basil, has antimicrobial and anti-inflammatory properties and is widely used in Ayurveda.
plants.habitat: Found in warm and humid climates, mainly in plains, gardens, and cultivated fields.

plants.name: Mulethi
plants.description: Mulethi (Licorice) is known for its soothing effects on the throat, digestion, and respiratory health.
plants.habitat: Thrives in sandy and loamy soils, commonly found in riverbanks and semi-arid regions.

plants.name: Neem
plants.description: Neem is a powerful antibacterial and antifungal plant, widely used for skin care and medicinal purposes.
plants.habitat: Grows in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in dry, arid, and semi-arid regions.

plants.name: Bael
plants.description: Bael is used for treating digestive disorders, particularly constipation and diarrhea.
plants.habitat: Flourishes in dry forests, hilly regions, and well-drained soils.

plants.name: Ashwagandha
plants.description: Ashwagandha is an adaptogenic herb that helps reduce stress, improve energy, and boost immunity.
plants.habitat: Found in dry regions, sandy soils, and arid zones.

plants.name: Safed Musli
plants.description: Safed Musli is known for its aphrodisiac properties and is used to boost vitality and strength.
plants.habitat: Grows in well-drained, loamy soils in subtropical forests and grasslands.

plants.name: Turmeric
plants.description: Turmeric is known for its anti-inflammatory and antioxidant properties, widely used in medicine and cooking.
plants.habitat: Prefers warm, humid climates, commonly cultivated in tropical and subtropical regions.

plants.name: Giloy
plants.description: Giloy is an immunity booster and is used to treat fever, infections, and chronic diseases.
plants.habitat: Thrives in tropical and subtropical regions, often found climbing on trees in forests and gardens.

plants.name: Brahmi
plants.description: Brahmi is well-known for its brain-boosting properties, enhancing memory and cognitive functions.
plants.habitat: Grows in wet, marshy areas, near riverbanks and humid tropical environments.

plants.name: Gotu Kola
plants.description: Gotu Kola is a medicinal herb used for improving memory, reducing stress, and healing wounds.
plants.habitat: Prefers moist, swampy areas, found in tropical and subtropical climates.
